metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2938 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's implementation of Pressure Stall Information. While the feature is disabled by default, it could allow an attacker to crash the system or have other memory-corruption side effects.

notes.Note: sbeattie> on s390x/focal and newer, CONFIG_PSI_DEFAULT_DISABLED is set (see LP: #1876044), so requires a boot command line argument; other arches have it enabled.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
